title: Victorian pervert's sick response to a 13-year-old girl when she told him her age before having sex
text:
A Victorian man who sexually assaulted a 13-year-old girl after a party said 'who cares' when she revealed her age, then told her to keep quiet.

Nathan Schembri admitted three counts of sexual penetration of the girl in 2015 after a party in northeast Victoria.

The now 22-year-old repeatedly asked his victim if it was her 'first time' and said he felt bad after she said it was.

'You continued even when you knew she was only 13 ... it was selfish and disrespectful behaviour to a girl so young,' Judge Felicity Hampel said on Tuesday.

Nathan Schembri admitted three counts of sexual penetration of the girl in 2015 after a party in northeast Victoria (stock image)

The girl initially told Schembri she was 15 but revealed she was actually 13 after they got physical.

'Is it bad you know I'm 13?' the victim asked him.

'No, who cares, it's already been done,' he replied, before they had another sexual encounter the same night.

The next morning Schembri told the teenager to keep quiet.

'Don't tell anyone what happened because it's illegal,' he told his victim.

He also sent her a message on social media urging her not to tell.

'Seriously, do not tell anyone. You cannot say a word,' the message read.

He initially denied the offending when he was questioned by police but later pleaded guilty.

The girl had previously told the court the incident left her feeling like 'a piece of meat'.

'I had my childhood taken away from me and my dignity stripped,' she said.

The girl initially told Schembri she was 15 but revealed she was actually 13 after they got physical. He was also jailed for unrelated drug offences, bringing his total sentence to five years but he could be released on parole in two years and six months (court pictured)

The judge described the offending as 'deeply disturbing' during her sentencing remarks in the County Court.

'You knew she was only 15, and that in itself is bad enough because she was underage and that you continued when you knew she was 13 clearly makes it worse,' Judge Hampel said.

However, she noted Schembri had started to turn his life around, had stopped using drugs and maintained vocational employment.

The judge hit out at a personal reference provided for Schembri which was written on the letterhead of a Catholic school.

She said it was 'inappropriate' considering the 'well documented poor behaviour of the Catholic church' in relation to child sex abuse.

'I'm considering making a formal protest about it, it's just wrong,' she said.

The judge also took into account Schembri's age at the time of the offence, his remorse and believed he would be a good prospect for rehabilitation.

He was also jailed for unrelated drug offences, bringing his total sentence to five years but he could be released on parole in two years and six months.

After he was sentenced the convicted sex offender spoke to his tearful mother and passed a letter to her.
description: Nathan Schembri admitted three counts of sexual penetration of the girl in 2015. The Victorian girl initially told him she was 15 before revealing her true age of 13.
